bug.short_desc: Weather service used by libmateweather has been discontinued
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: libmateweather uses the hard-coded URL http://weather.noaa.gov/mgetmetar.php to retrieve weather data. According to the homepage this service has been discontinued resulting in 404 Not Found.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): libmateweather-1.14.0-1
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. grep MateWeather-WARNING /var/log/messages 2. 3.
URL should be updated, ideally configurable in a config file.

It looks like this has been fixed upstream: https://github.com/mate-desktop/libmateweather/commit/835055e0d0b950d3f66ad236de7e40942f6f7d8e
... although it just replaces the NOAA URL with http://aviationweather.gov/metar/data, and it remains unconfigurable.

Created attachment 1194036 Patch from upstream to change the NOAA weather data URL to use aviationweather.gov
Taken from https://github.com/mate-desktop/libmateweather/commit/835055e0d0b950d3f66ad236de7e40942f6f7d8e
Tested it on Fedora 24, weather app now shows correct weather, but the IWIN data is still pointing at NOAA so there's no forecast.
*** Bug 1371120 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

*** Bug 1370781 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
What about Fedore 23 stable ? Shouldn't this bug be closed after libmateweather-1.14.2-1.fc23 is pushed too ?
What about Fedora 23 stable ? Shouldn't this bug be closed after libmateweather-1.14.2-1.fc23 is pushed too ?

Report is against f24 and not f23. Btw. you only need to enable update-testing, install the update and leave karma at https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-bc42f233f9 to fasten the process.
